Description: Mudstone (greywacke) cosmetic-palette carved in the form of a fish with drilled eye, a small mouth indicated by incision, incised lines along top edge. Two fins on the lower edge are indicated by carving, and the tail is detailed with incised lines and separated from the body by notches. Single piercing at the top.
Curator's comments: Palette type 45D in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery and Palettes (1921).
Acquisition name: Donated by: Mrs Janet Elizabeth Birch
